text:
I would like to use Jmeter to do automated functional testing that runs unsupervised at specific times - eg 4 times on each day. Currently you can only do this using an external scheduler.
It seems like an easy enhancement to change the current behaviour of the scheduler to enable this.
If we could enter a regexp in the start time of the scheduler and set the cycle count to forever the problem would be solved - whenever the regexp matches true against the current time the test would run.

Thanks.
SWK
creator: ralikwen@hotmail.com

text:
Seems to me this is out of scope for JMeter.

It's also not easy to implement.

So won't fix, unless anyone provides a patch with test cases and documentation.
